p: Crinum jagus (syn. = Crinum giganteum) grows in Senegal and belongs to a genus which was shown to be very rich in crinine-type alkaloids [ 36]. The metabolites present in the aqueous and organic extract of C. jagus showed potential for the treatment of inflammatory processes [ 58], antibacterial [ 59], sedative [ 60], inhibition of cholinesterases [ 61], and antiviral [ 62] activities.
